item.title: 博世以 80 亿美元收购 JCI 空调资产
item.description: 罗伯特-博世有限公司计划以 80 亿美元的价格收购江森自控国际有限公司（Johnson Controls International Plc）的暖气和通风设备资产，以实现公司产品组合的多元化，不再局限于汽车用品。【原文：Robert Bosch GmbH plans to buy heating and ventilation assets from Johnson Controls International Plc for $8 billion, as the company diversifies its portfolio away from automotive supplies.】

item.title: 空中客车公司因积压订单过多被迫拒绝部分订单
item.description: 空中客车公司（Airbus SE）因积压了大量订单而不得不拒绝一些飞机订单，这凸显了航空公司持续强劲的需求与制造商难以快速生产飞机之间的不匹配。【原文：Airbus SE has had to turn down some aircraft orders because of its huge backlog, highlighting the mismatch between the continued strong demand from airlines and manufacturers struggling to produce their planes fast enough.】

item.title: 昆巴铁矿石公司认为南非新政府对铁路改革持开放态度
item.description: 英美资源集团（Anglo American Plc）的南非铁矿石业务部门称，南非新政府致力于解决限制出口的物流瓶颈问题，但同时承认这一问题可能需要数年时间才能解决。【原文：Anglo American Plc’s South African iron ore unit said the country’s new government is committed to grappling with logistics bottlenecks that are limiting exports, while acknowledging the problem could take several years to resolve.】

item.title: 在制药业最热门的市场中，二十几名患者价值数十亿美元
item.description: 参加罗氏公司肥胖药丸研究的 25 人几乎不够一场足球比赛双方的人数。然而，他们的体重减轻却在一天之内使这家瑞士制药商的市值增加了 168 亿美元，这只是基于微小试验的成功而进行的一系列重大股价变动中的最新一次。【原文：The 25 people in Roche Holding AG’s obesity pill study would barely be enough to field both sides of a soccer match. Yet their weight loss added $16.8 billion to the Swiss drugmaker’s market value in a day, only the latest in a series of big share moves based on success in tiny trials.】

item.title: 莫迪连任后首份预算案的赢家和输家
item.description: 纳伦德拉-莫迪（Narendra Modi）第三次连任总理以来，印度的首份预算案重点关注创造就业、支持当地企业和基础设施建设，同时又不至于出现赤字。【原文：India’s first budget since Narendra Modi was reelected as prime minister for a third term focused on creating jobs and supporting local businesses and infrastructure without blowing out the deficit.】

item.title: 国营租赁公司酝酿人民币债券替代计划
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，国有背景的上海兴业金融租赁有限公司通知一些投资者，该公司可能没有足够的现金偿还8月3日到期的债券，正在考虑其他计划。【原文：State-backed Shanghai Industrial Financial Leasing informed some investors that it might not have enough cash to repay a bond due Aug. 3 and is considering alternative plans, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 莫迪政府基本维持借贷不变，债券走低
item.description: 印度政府小幅下调了本财年的年度债券销售额。债券走低。【原文：India’s government marginally reduced its annual bond sales for the current fiscal year. Bonds edged lower.】

item.title: 欧洲股市变化不大，财报成为焦点
item.description: 欧洲股市周二变化不大，因为投资者准备迎接本周的大量财报，并密切关注美国大选的最新进展。【原文：European shares were little changed Tuesday as investors prepared for a deluge of earnings this week and kept an eye on the latest US election developments.】

item.title: 捷克央行行长称不排除降息半点的可能性
item.description: 捷克央行可能很快就会缩减降息步伐，但一位高级决策者拒绝排除下周最后一次降息半个百分点的可能性。【原文：The Czech central bank is likely to scale back the pace of interest-rate cuts soon, but a senior policymaker refused to rule out a final half a percentage point move next week.】

item.title: 印度将提高资本利得税，股市繁荣受挫
item.description: 印度提议提高股票投资资本利得税和股票衍生品交易税，以浇灭该国 5 万亿美元股票市场的投机热情。【原文：India proposed to raise taxes on capital gains from equity investments and the levy on stock derivatives trades in a bid to douse the speculative fervor in the country’s $5 trillion stock market.】

item.title: 情绪低迷，中国股市出现一月以来最严重下挫
item.description: 由于三中全会后缺乏重大政策支持，看跌情绪更加浓厚，中国股市出现了六个月来最严重的下挫。【原文：Chinese stocks saw their worst selloff in six months as a lack of major policy support following the Third Plenum reinforced bearish sentiment.】

item.title: 金多斯称九月对欧洲央行决策 "更方便
item.description: 欧洲中央银行副行长路易斯-德金多斯（Luis de Guindos）表示，欧洲中央银行将在秋季举行的下一次理事会会议上更好地决定利率。【原文：The European Central Bank will be in a better position to decide on interest rates at its next Governing Council meeting in the autumn, Vice President Luis de Guindos said.】

item.title: 欧洲仍与中国争夺俄罗斯管道天然气的最大市场
item.description: 俄罗斯入侵乌克兰两年多后，欧洲仍在与中国争夺俄罗斯天然气工业股份公司（Gazprom PJSC）管道天然气的最大买家头衔。【原文：Europe still contends with China for the title of top buyer of Gazprom PJSC’s pipeline gas, more than two years after Russia’s invasion of Ukraine slashed its western energy sales.】

item.title: 莫迪承诺为盟国提供 240 亿美元的就业和财政援助
item.description: 印度总理纳伦德拉-莫迪（Narendra Modi）承诺提供 2 万亿卢比（约合 239 亿美元），用于促进印度的就业和改善教育，并为其联合政府中的新盟友增加支出。【原文：Prime Minister Narendra Modi pledged 2 trillion rupees ($23.9 billion) to boost jobs and improve education in India, and increased spending for new allies in his coalition government.】

item.title: 埃尼公司与 KKR 就出售 Enilive 单位股权达成独家协议
item.description: 意大利能源巨头埃尼公司（Eni SpA）与 KKR & Co.就出售 Enilive 公司 20% 至 25% 的股份签署了临时排他性协议。【原文：Italian energy major Eni SpA signed a temporary exclusivity agreement with KKR & Co. related to the sale of a 20% to 25% stake in Enilive.】

item.title: 英国富时 100 指数强劲反弹后将下滑
item.description: 2024 年 6 月 20 日星期四，英国伦敦金融城，左为英格兰银行（BOE），右为皇家交易所。英国通胀率近三年来首次回落至英格兰银行设定的 2% 的目标。【原文：The Bank of England (BOE), left, and Royal Exchange, right, in the City of London, UK, on Thursday, June 20, 2024. British inflation fell back to the Bank of England’s 2% target for the first time in almost three years.】

item.title: 据说丰田计划从 MUFG 和 SMFG 战略性回购股票
item.description: 据知情人士透露，丰田汽车公司将宣布从日本主要银行和保险公司回购自己的股票，作为1万亿日元回购计划和与金融合作伙伴解除战略持股的更广泛计划的一部分。【原文：Toyota Motor Corp. is set to announce the buyback of its own shares from major Japanese banks and insurers as part of a ¥1 trillion repurchase plan and a broader program to unwind strategic shareholdings with financial partners, people with knowledge of the matter said.】

item.title: 瑞士宝盛选择高盛资深人士博林格为新任首席执行官
item.description: 瑞士宝盛集团（Julius Baer Group Ltd）已聘请斯蒂芬-博林格（Stefan Bollinger）担任下一任首席执行官，这位名不见经传的人选将领导这家瑞士财富管理公司，努力与去年的Signa房地产丑闻划清界限。【原文：Julius Baer Group Ltd has hired Stefan Bollinger to be its next chief executive officer, a relatively unknown pick to lead the Swiss wealth manager as it seeks to draw a line under last year’s Signa real estate scandal.】

item.title: 开始一天生活所需的五件事欧洲
item.description:
及时了解市场监测情况

Get up to speed with what the markets are monitoring

】

item.title: 新加坡核心通胀率自 2022 年以来首次降至 3% 以下
item.description: 新加坡 6 月份的核心通胀率降幅超过预期，这使得央行有余力专注于保护这个依赖贸易的经济体免受全球冲击的影响。【原文：Singapore’s core inflation decelerated more than expected in June, allowing the central bank room to focus on shielding the trade-reliant economy from global shocks.】

item.title: Visi Media 的贷款人称法官接受了 5.6 亿美元的债务索赔
item.description: PT Visi Media Asia 的一个债权人团体表示，它说服了雅加达的一名法官完全接受其 5.6 亿美元的债务索赔要求，允许其参与公司重组，并有可能收回其成员的部分欠款。【原文：A group of PT Visi Media Asia’s creditors said it convinced a judge in Jakarta to fully accept its $560 million debt claims, allowing it to participate in the company’s restructuring and potentially recover some of what its members are owed.】

item.title: 经济复苏加快，越南信贷增长加速
item.description: 随着经济复苏加速，越南 2024 年上半年的信贷扩张几乎比一年前翻了一番，但仍远低于央行的目标。【原文：Vietnam’s credit expansion in the first half of 2024 almost doubled from a year ago as economic recovery accelerates, although still way below the central bank’s goal.】

item.title: 印度预算案包括安抚莫迪盟友的计划，并将重点放在就业上
item.description: 在印度新联合政府执政后的首份预算案中，莫迪预计将坚持抑制财政赤字的计划，同时仍将减税和增加福利支出，以让盟友满意。【原文：In India’s first budget under a new coalition government, Modi is expected to stick to a plan of curbing the fiscal deficit, while still cutting taxes and boosting welfare spending to keep his allies happy.】

item.title: 中国降息偷走全会闷雷
item.description:
中共大聚会后的 微幅宽松政策对经济的刺激作用不大。【原文：

The economy won’t feel much stimulus from the minimal easing after the Communist Party’s big gathering.

】

item.title: 全会未能激发灵感，铁矿石下挫逼近 100 美元考验线
item.description: 铁矿石跌至每吨 100 美元的临界点附近，原因是中国的政策会议未能提供重大刺激措施，同时供应保持强劲。【原文：Iron ore fell near the $100-a-ton threshold as a policy meeting in China failed to deliver major stimulus, while supplies stayed strong.】

item.title: 埃及人等待交易，因为货币贬值导致价格意外暴跌
item.description:
自埃及镑贬值以来，汽车和家具等大件商品的价格一直在下降，这与大多数经济理论背道而驰。【原文：

Big-ticket items like cars and furniture have been getting cheaper since the Egyptian pound was devalued — and that flies in the face of most economic theory.

】

item.title: 摩根大通警告英镑反弹，Amundi 也加入英镑多头行列
item.description: 尽管摩根大通（JPMorgan Chase & Co.【原文：The pound’s world-beating rally has turned Amundi SA from bears to bulls, even as JPMorgan Chase & Co. warns positioning looks stretched.】

item.title: Ozempic 制造商诺和诺德启动另一个大型建筑项目
item.description: 诺和诺德公司（Novo Nordisk A/S）已获得土地和规划许可，这可能是该公司在丹麦的下一个主要厂址，因为这家拥有 100 年历史的公司正努力满足对其减肥药不断飙升的需求。【原文：Novo Nordisk A/S has secured land and planning permissions for what may be its next major factory site in Denmark as the 100-year-old company works to meet soaring demand for its weight loss drugs.】

item.title: 菲律宾地产股在在线赌场禁令余波中暴跌
item.description: 菲律宾总统小费迪南德-马科斯（Ferdinand Marcos Jr.）下令禁止针对中国赌客的在线赌场，这引发了周二地产股的暴跌，因为关闭赌场可能导致许多办公场所空置。【原文：Philippine President Ferdinand Marcos Jr.’s order to ban online casinos targeting Chinese bettors triggered a slump in property stocks on Tuesday, as the shutdown could render many office spaces vacant.】

item.title: 澳大利亚养老基金 CFS 将扩大基础设施资产规模
item.description: 澳大利亚最大的养老金和财富管理公司之一第一州殖民公司（Colonial First State）计划增加其私人基础设施的持股量，以抵御市场波动和通货膨胀的影响。【原文：Colonial First State, one of Australia’s biggest pension and wealth managers, plans to boost its private infrastructure holdings as a shelter from volatile markets and sticky inflation.】
